course_title: Writing and Inquiry in the Liberal Arts: No Theme/Student's Choice
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 16 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0 of 6
class_notes:
Placement exam required


In this section of English 185, we will examine the connection between writing and inquiry across a range of disciplines, including disciplines in the humanities, social sciences, and natural sciences. Beyond core readings on writing, students will be free to pursue topics of their own choosing in their research, reading, and writing and will receive guided instruction on pursuing effective independent inquiry and writing on their chosen topics.
course_description: Introduction to writing and inquiry in the liberal arts, with attention to variations across disciplines and rhetorical situations. Intensive practice in academic reading, writing, and research. Guidance in writing strategies and processes for diverse purposes and genres. First-year writing requirement.
